info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:51PM EDT until July 24 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF EFFINGHAM...CHATHAM AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 450 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Meinhard, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Pooler, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Hunter Army Airfield, Godley Station, Savannah International Airport, Downtown Savannah, Windsor Forest, Rincon, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Bloomingdale, Meinhard and Monteith. This warning includes the following interstates: I-16 between mile markers 150 and 167. I-516 between mile markers 3 and 9. I-95 in South Carolina near mile marker 2. I-95 in Georgia between mile markers 98 and 112. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
